body:
objects/js-array-buffer-inl.h and objects/js-array-buffer.h, JSTypedArray related data path:
- JSArrayBuffer::GetByteLength(): for SAB/GSAB resizable, returns backing_store->byte_length(seq_cst), otherwise byte_length() from kRawByteLengthOffset.
- JSArrayBuffer::byte_length()/max_byte_length(): ReadBoundedSizeField at kRawByteLengthOffset/kRawMaxByteLengthOffset. Backing store pointer via external pointer table; extension tracks backing store.
- JSArrayBufferView::byte_offset/byte_length; WasDetached() returns buffer()->was_detached(); bit_field has is_length_tracking, is_backed_by_rab; IsVariableLength() if either.
- JSTypedArray::GetLengthOrOutOfBounds(): if WasDetached() -> 0; if variable length, delegated GetVariableLengthOrOutOfBounds; else fixed byte_length()/element_size(). GetByteLength similar. IsDetachedOrOutOfBounds: if rab-backed, may be out-of-bounds depending on current buffer byte length; otherwise false for AB/SAB and GSAB without RAB.
- JSTypedArray::external_pointer and base_pointer; DataPtr() returns external_pointer + base_pointer (kOffHeapDataPtrEqualsExternalPointer true). SetOffHeapDataPtr adjusts external_pointer and sets base_pointer to Smi::zero with release store; is_on_heap() tests base_pointer != Smi::zero.
- RAB/GSAB support in elements-kind: objects/elements-kind.h defines both plain and RAB_GSAB_* typed array kinds and helpers: IsTypedArrayElementsKind, IsRabGsabTypedArrayElementsKind, IsTypedArrayOrRabGsabTypedArrayElementsKind, ElementsKindToShiftSize used by length computation and addressing.

Notes for fast-path disabling:
- Maglev GraphBuilder explicitly bails for IsRabGsabTypedArrayElementsKind in TryBuildElementAccessOnTypedArray and polymorphic paths (reducing false fast-path); also rejects FLOAT16/BIGINT64/64
- Detachment: GraphBuilder consults ArrayBufferDetachingProtector, otherwise emits CheckTypedArrayNotDetached node.
- 32/64-bit length type is size_t IntPtr in LoadTypedArrayLength; bounds check compares Uint32 index vs IntPtr length.
explanation: This record consolidates the object model: how typed array lengths/byte-length are obtained, how DataPtr/backing store works, and RAB/GSAB semantics and flags used by the Maglev fast path, as well as elements-kind helpers. These anchors are needed to reason about length variability and fast path eligibility.
file_line: objects/js-array-buffer-inl.h: size-related methods and flags; objects/js-array-buffer.h: class layout; objects/elements-kind.h: helpers
